AFR2130 - Team and Leadership Fundamenta.name: AFR2130 - Team and Leadership Fundamentals I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the development of air power from experiments by 18th-century balloonists to the achievement of combat air power capabilities during World War II. Hands-on training required in accordance with the AFROTC program.

AFR1111 - Heritage and Values of the Uni.name: AFR1111 - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A brief review of the Army, Navy, and Marine forces. An introduction to special operations and counterinsurgency.

AFR2131 - Team and Leadership Fundamenta.name: AFR2131 - Team and Leadership Fundamentals II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the development of aerospace capabilities since World War II, highlighting technological advancements and the role of aerospace power in the contemporary world.

AFR1101 - Heritage and Values of the Uni.name: AFR1101 - Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History, mission, organization, and doctrine of the United States Air Force and a study of U.S. Strategic Offensive and Defensive Forces. Hands on training required in accordance with the AFROTC program.
